channel.title: Compiling Error on Vps
channel.description: Whenever I try to compile on my Vps. The Screen comes up and go away. What is wrong here? Oh and I do have the lastest Java and my server online now. It's just that I can't Compile.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2009, 08:16:28 pm[/size][hr]Someone help i'm new to this Vps. also I can compile on my computer, but not Vps.

item.title: Compiling Error on Vps
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Here try my compiler

@echo off @TITLE atrix676 COMPILER if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit
save as compiler.bat

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Error on Vps
item.dc:creator: @Taintisacoder Taintisacoder
item.description:
@Taintisacoder wrote:

Edit your jdk version into the compiler. like i see in your compiler it says C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe and if you had jdk 6.3 this would work. but if you have like 5.17 or something you would have to change the compiler to this C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_17\bin\javac.exe. Hope i helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Error on Vps
item.dc:creator: @Cuban0_Ftw Cuban0 Ftw
item.description:
@Cuban0_Ftw wrote:

NightVision,

TBH, I don’t think your VPS has anything to do with it unless it’s messing with your comp. The latest Java version would be 13 to my knowledge but it’s different for everyone, go to Sun.com to test your system and get the recommended Java for your OS. Here’s some tips, Try right clicking and editing your compiler and it’ll say something like
“@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause”,(Depending on what type of compiler your using) Now that’s my compiler but you would change the “jdk1.6.0_03” to your java version, so mine would look like “jdk1.6.0_13” but that’s for me. Also make sure your Enviromental Variables are correct. If you need some help on it look into the tutorial section of moparisthebest.com, I’m pretty sure it has a tut or 2 concerning this matter. Well hopefully that solved it. Good luck :D.

Read full topic
